page.title: 14Dalkeith Fire Station
page.content:
The present building was opened in 1970. 28 men are stationed here. The local area covered is approximately 250 square miles.
The men work 4 days per week - a total of 48 hours, ie 2 x 10 hour day shifts and 2 x 14 hours night shifts.
2 fire tenders are located here plus 1 van. Each tender carries a maximum of 6 men, a minimum of 5. Equipment includes breathing apparatus, high pressure hose, protective clothing and an axe. Each tender carries 600 gallons of water. Other duties include checking equipment, practical drills and technical training programmes. The most common cause of domestic fires is chip pan igniting. At the end of 1984 there were many chimney fires.
